subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text:
; “shield”
: Compare {{cog|my|လွှား||oblong shield}} ({{zh-ref|Starostin}}). It is unclear whether {{cog|cdm|tr=dhəl}} is related ({{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}}). {{etystub|zh}}

; “dong”
: Borrowed from {{bor|zh|vi|đồng}}, from {{der|zh|zh|-}} {{ltc-l|銅|copper}}.

[[File:Godless_florin.jpg|thumb|1849 “godless florin”]]
; “guilder; gulden; rupiah”
: Probably first referred to the {{w|two shilling coin}}, also known as the ''florin'', which had four crowned cruciform shields with a rose in the centre. It was later used for the {{w|Dutch guilder}}, which replaced an older currency known as the ''florin''. Since the guilder was used in Indonesia, when the rupiah replaced it, the Chinese name for the guilder continued to be used for the rupiah.
